Articles.Content: Enjoy and Happy Holidays my friends!

Mind if I use this in my XMAS HELL 2015 playlist? The 2014 playlist is alas solid already:

As a fair warning, this is how I'm describing the 2014 playlist:

Does holiday music overload your ears? Does Kris Kringle make you CRINGE? Got party guests that have overworn their welcome? Here is the thing you need! Put this assortment of Christmas tunes on. It starts suave and ...., then goes wrong, and keeps going wrong until it forms a festive shrieking black hole of wrongness from which no carol can escape. Three hours later, anyone who is still there with you should be considered a dear friend worth spending the holidays with. And cheers to you if you listen to the whole thing and are still grinning.

Thanks! BTW, I'm not saying this is hellish. It's actually very pretty and frenetic, like some Final Fantasy music I've heard. But it sounds like something that could mess with minds after a while, and that's a good quality for this playlist.

Here's another version (sufficiently nerdy for this forum) version:

Happy holidays everyone!

Thanks! BTW, I'm not saying this is hellish. It's actually very pretty and frenetic, like some Final Fantasy music I've heard. But it sounds like something that could mess with minds after a while, and that's a good quality for this playlist.

Lol, As long as it is enjoyed! It's the only reason music is made in my opinion

Also, if you all do wish, check this one out. It's rather relaxing

https://soundcloud.com/billy-winn-2/pax-serena
Nice work, Jatwaa! I also like what you've shared in this other thread.

Nice work, Jatwaa! I also like what you've shared in this other thread.

Thanks Dispatcher!

BTW all, updated the Carol of the Bells to the final version, better mixed and more staccato less note bleed. I plan to have it on Youtube today or tomorrow.
